1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 d6 4. Bc4 Nf6 5. Ng5
1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 d6 4. Bc4 Nf6 5. Ng5 Be6 6. Bxe6 fxe6 7. Nxe6 Qe7 8. Nb5
comment:
Nf8 is best. White is just a pawn up. A possible plan
would be to play Nf8, d3,0-0, Bg5 and Nd5 trading down into a winning endgame.

comment: A one move threat, Be7 completing development is far superior.

a check if you have no follow up.

Rc1 Nxe1 18. Qa4+ Kf7 19. Bxe1 Nxe4 20. Qd7+ Kf6 21. Qd8+ Be7 22. Qd7 Nd2 23. Bxd2 Qxd2 24. Rf1 Rf8 25. Qxb7 Rf7 26. Qxa7 d5 27. b5 e4 28. a4 Ke5 29. Qe3 Qxe3 30. fxe3 Rxf1+ 31. Kxf1 Bd8 32. g3 d4 33. exd4+ Kxd4 34. h4 Kd3 35. Ke1
comment:
Both sides missed their chances in this mistake filled game. White one the
opening battle but gave away a winning middle game. The early Nb5 was fancy
but it gave black 2 minor pieces for a rook which in most cases favors the 2
minors.
